ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to read scientific papers directed towards various audiences (ex. research papers, Science articles, etc.) and how to better present ideas that I plan to do research on over the summer.
I learned about how the world of science works, and how different audiences affect the way we discuss scientific discoveries.
I learned the most effective way to read a refereed paper and scientific papers, and have also gotten some practice with writing them.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The seminar format of the class really felt like the class had some sort of connection with each other. The guest lecturers also were a great addition to the class.
I would say that it is a well taught course as the seminar style allows everyone to speak, and share their thoughts while also giving the lecturer room to speak for long periods of time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to any student who might think about doing summer research. The guaranteed funding is a big plus of the class compared to the amount of effort that you need to put in (at least first semester).

I would highly recommend this course to anyone in the STARS program and is not a pre-med/bio major. Prof. Bailyn is such an amazing person, and is sure to help you a lot at the beginning of your academic journey at Yale!
Yes 100% if you want to get into scientific research, even if you have done research in the past.

I would recommend this course to others as you learn about what the world of science looks like and are equipped with the tools to engage with your respective field effectively. The only caveat I would give is that you would have to note that this course lasts a full year.

I would recommend this course to another student, especially if you are someone with a passion for STEM and looking for a low stakes way in which to learn more about different STEM pathways and learn practical skills, such as reading a research paper and even how to write one.
